Articles.Content: What is ModuleJointMotorTest and how do I use it? It was used on Squadcast just now, but I only caught the tail-end. I'd like to experiment with ModuleJointMotorTest, but I don't know how it works, what modifiers it uses.

add this this to a part like an octaginal strut and it can't be physics less

MODULE

{

name = ModuleJointMotorTest

}

}

Edited August 9, 2014 by Mach_XXII

I added the module to a cubic strut but it doesn't seem to do much. EDIT: I need to give it physics.

EDIT2: It still doesn't work. is there anything else that needs to be added?

Edited August 9, 2014 by GregroxMun

If you added it to a part that's mass was .001. give it a mass of like .05 or something. (Plus changing the physics significance line) Also he has an extra } at the end of what you need to add. You add:

MODULE
{ 
name = ModuleJointMotorTest
}

And you have to place that before the final } in the part config file.

Keep in mind, there's a reason this isn't on a released part yet, it is very buggy and can cause nullref errors easily.
Which Squadcast? Is it recorded or live?
